summary: Rambutan is a tropical tree and its edible fruit, native to Southeast Asia. It's part of the Sapindaceae family and is related to lychee and longan. The fruit has a unique appearance with soft, spiky hair covering its outer skin. Inside, the flesh is sweet and juicy, often compared to grapes. Rambutan trees can grow up to 20 meters tall and have been cultivated in various tropical regions for their delicious fruit.
title: Rambutan
